rev.comment: removing some text: the Amazon Appstore is already linked above
rev.diff:
Line 17: Line 17:
}}
}}
The '''App Store''' is a digital [[Application software|application]] [[Digital distribution|distribution]] platform for [[iOS (Apple)|iOS]] developed and maintained by [[Apple Inc.|Apple]].
The '''App Store''' is a digital [[Application software|application]] [[Digital distribution|distribution]] platform for [[iOS (Apple)|iOS]] developed and maintained by [[Apple Inc.|Apple]].
â   â
Amazon also has an App Store for Android.
 
The Apple service allows users to browse and download applications from the [[iTunes Store]] that were developed with the [[iOS SDK]] or Mac SDK and published through Apple. Depending on the application, they are available either for free or at a cost. The applications can be downloaded directly to a target device, or downloaded onto a [[Personal computer|PC]] or [[Macintosh|Mac]] via [[iTunes]]. 30% of revenue from the store go to Apple, and 70% go to the producer of the app.<ref>[http://venturebeat.com/2008/06/11/analyst-thees-a-great-future-in-iphone-apps/ "Analyst: Thereâs a great future in iPhone apps"], Venture Beat, June 11, 2008.</ref> The App Store opened on July 10, 2008 via an update to iTunes. On July 11, the iPhone 3G was launched and came pre-loaded with iOS 2.0.1 with App Store support; new iOS 2.0.1 firmware for iPhone and iPod Touch was also made available via iTunes.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.apple.com/pr/library/2008/06/09iphone.html |title=Apple Introduces the New iPhone 3G |publisher=Apple |date=2008-06-09 |accessdate=2009-09-16}}</ref> As of June 6, 2011, there are at least 425,000 third-party apps officially available on the App Store.<ref name="ASE20110606"/> As of January 18, 2011, the App Store had over 9.9 [[billion]] downloads, which was announced via the company's "10 Billion App Countdown".<ref>[http://www.apple.com/itunes/10-billion-app-countdown/ "10 Billion App Countdown"] Apple 2011-01-14.</ref> At 10:26 AM GMT on Saturday, January 22, 2011,<ref>[http://www.setteb.it/?p=10452 10:26 AM GMT on Saturday, January 22, 2011] setteB.IT 2011-01-22.</ref> the 10 billionth app was downloaded from Apple App Store. The [[mean]] revenue per application is estimated to be [[United States dollar|US$]]8,700, although data is not publicly available.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://communities-dominate.blogs.com/brands/2010/06/full-analysis-of-iphone-economics-its-bad-news-and-then-it-gets-worse.html |title=Full Analysis of iPhone Economics - it is bad news. And then it gets worse |publisher=Communities Dominate Brands |date=2010-06-22}}</ref> As of May 2011, Apple approves its 500,000th app, 37 percent of all apps are free with the average price $3.64.<ref>http://news.yahoo.com/s/yblog_technews/20110524/tc_yblog_technews/apple-approves-its-500000th-app-but-do-you-care</ref>
The Apple service allows users to browse and download applications from the [[iTunes Store]] that were developed with the [[iOS SDK]] or Mac SDK and published through Apple. Depending on the application, they are available either for free or at a cost. The applications can be downloaded directly to a target device, or downloaded onto a [[Personal computer|PC]] or [[Macintosh|Mac]] via [[iTunes]]. 30% of revenue from the store go to Apple, and 70% go to the producer of the app.<ref>[http://venturebeat.com/2008/06/11/analyst-thees-a-great-future-in-iphone-apps/ "Analyst: Thereâs a great future in iPhone apps"], Venture Beat, June 11, 2008.</ref> The App Store opened on July 10, 2008 via an update to iTunes. On July 11, the iPhone 3G was launched and came pre-loaded with iOS 2.0.1 with App Store support; new iOS 2.0.1 firmware for iPhone and iPod Touch was also made available via iTunes.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.apple.com/pr/library/2008/06/09iphone.html |title=Apple Introduces the New iPhone 3G |publisher=Apple |date=2008-06-09 |accessdate=2009-09-16}}</ref> As of June 6, 2011, there are at least 425,000 third-party apps officially available on the App Store.<ref name="ASE20110606"/> As of January 18, 2011, the App Store had over 9.9 [[billion]] downloads, which was announced via the company's "10 Billion App Countdown".<ref>[http://www.apple.com/itunes/10-billion-app-countdown/ "10 Billion App Countdown"] Apple 2011-01-14.</ref> At 10:26 AM GMT on Saturday, January 22, 2011,<ref>[http://www.setteb.it/?p=10452 10:26 AM GMT on Saturday, January 22, 2011] setteB.IT 2011-01-22.</ref> the 10 billionth app was downloaded from Apple App Store. And then it gets worse |publisher=Communities Dominate Brands |date=2010-06-22}}</ref> As of May 2011, Apple approves its 500,000th app, 37 percent of all apps are free with the average price $3.64.<ref>http://news.yahoo.com/s/yblog_technews/20110524/tc_yblog_technews/apple-approves-its-500000th-app-but-do-you-care</ref>
